concepts.title: Variables
concepts.summary: Variables are containers that store data values. They have a name and can hold different types of information like numbers, text, or true/false values.
concepts.sample_question: What is a variable and how do you create one in Python?

concepts.title: Loops
concepts.summary: Loops allow you to repeat code multiple times. The most common types are 'for' loops (repeat a specific number of times) and 'while' loops (repeat while a condition is true).
concepts.sample_question: Can you explain the difference between a for loop and a while loop?

concepts.title: Functions
concepts.summary: Functions are reusable blocks of code that perform specific tasks. They can take inputs (parameters) and return outputs, helping organize code and avoid repetition.
concepts.sample_question: How do you define a function that takes two numbers and returns their sum?

concepts.title: Conditionals
concepts.summary: Conditionals use if/else statements to make decisions in code. They allow programs to execute different code paths based on whether certain conditions are true or false.
concepts.sample_question: How would you write an if statement to check if a number is positive or negative?
